statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Massachusetts 90, Xavier 86 (3OT)
article.story: AMHERST, Mass. (AP) -- Jeff Salovski scored a career-high 21 points, including eight in the third overtime, to lift Massachusetts to a 90-86 victory over Xavier on Saturday. Salovski, a 6-foot-11, 325-pound freshman, hit the last basket of regulation to tie the game at 60-60 and also hit the last two baskets of the second overtime period, tying the game at 78-78 with 10 seconds left after grabbing an offensive rebound. Salovski shot 9-for-10 from the field and was also tied for the team lead in rebounds with nine. Massachusetts (7-5, 1-1 Atlantic 10) had five players in double figures. Maurice Maxwell had 16 points nine rebounds and 10 assists, Anthony Anderson added 14 points, including four 3-pointers, Rashuan Freeman scored 12 and Stephane Lasme scored 11. Anderson's 3-pointer with 3:39 to play in the third overtime put UMass ahead for good, 81-80. Xavier's Dedrick Finn forced the second overtime when he hit a 3-pointer at the buzzer of the first extra period. The Musketeers (6-5, 0-1) were led by Finn, Justin Doellman and Stanley Burrell, all with 16 points. The Minutemen never trailed in the first half and led by as many as 10, 30-20. But a four-point play by Finn and a 3-pointer by Burrell pulled Xavier within 32-30 at halftime.
